Comments_List: I was able to look more closely into a specific area of interest and into the research process.

I learned a great deal from this course, including how to formulate an experiment and hypothesis, how to launch a survey on Qualtrics/mTurk, how to evaluate statistical data, and how to write a scientific paper.

Strengths - good amount of structure, organized, good communication with advisor

Weaknesses - none
Yes, directed research is always a good thing to do, especially in cognitive science.
Absolutely! It is an amazing opportunity to launch an original experiment and work closely with a professor or Ph.D. student at Yale.
